primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Subject (Hearer/Nation) must recognize and respond to the divine visitation (Object) to avoid judgment and achieve peace.

tekstueel_bewijs: If we but knew the things which belong to our peace
You have only to strike out on the path
One affirmative nod of your head, one firm yes in his direction

object.identificatie: Peace, New Life, and Recognition of God's Presence
tekstueel_bewijs: the things which belong unto thy peace
the glow and glory of the visitation of God

zender.identificatie: God as the Provider of Opportunities
tekstueel_bewijs: God has not given us all this for nothing
The God of the nations is testing us and sifting us
the far, high places of the Spirit can belong to you

helper.identificatie: Jesus (as a beckoning figure/example) and Memories of Great Men
tekstueel_bewijs: souls like Henry Beecher and S. Park Catman
you bit your lips and froze your hearts
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The primary obstacle is the human will's refusal to 'nod' or 'say yes,' rather than an ontological power like Sin or Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The National/Political Program: America must fulfill its democratic destiny.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: America
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Fulfillment of the American contract with history
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The spiritual visitation is mirrored in the national political responsibility.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has visited and sought you
The God of the nations is testing us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You have only to strike out on the path
We have not known what belongs unto our peace
You bit your lips and froze your hearts

voorbeelden: Especially ought we to think of our republic
Jerusalem should have echoed down the centuries
One affirmative nod of your head
one firm yes in his direction
because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation
the far, high places of the Spirit can belong to you

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human will (Vouloir) and knowledge (Savoir). It assumes that if the hearer 'knows' and 'wills' (nods), the 'can' (Pouvoir) follows automatically.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Jerusalem's destruction) to ~S2 (God's patience/opportunity) and urges a move to S1 (The Yes).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Synergistic: God provides the opportunity (~S2), but the human 'yes' is the catalyst for S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; judgment is presented as a consequence of missed opportunity rather than an ontological reality Christ must bear.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high Christological language and emphasizes God's patience, the deep actantial structure is anthropocentric, making the human 'nod' the decisive factor in salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: One affirmative nod of your head... and the wondrous adventures... can belong to you.
Jerusalem should have echoed down the centuries the cry of Joshua: 'But as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.'

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has not quit on you, will not until you've gotten completely deaf.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical and historical figures are used as models of what the hearer should have done or should do now.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how God sustained Jerusalem despite its rot, rather than how Jerusalem failed to be like Joshua.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform the 'correct' internal response (the 'nod').
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is contingent upon human sensitivity and recognition.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically coherent but theologically strained between God's sovereignty and the decisive human 'yes'.
spanning_punten: The 'Master is here' (Objective reality) vs. 'One affirmative nod' (Subjective condition).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ stands out and beckons and bids you trust yourself to him.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon lacks a clear mechanism for how the 'incompetent' human gains the power to 'nod'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as 'missing the day of visitation' or 'dull living' rather than total depravity.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'recruitment' narrative where the hearer is the Subject and God is the Object/Helper.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer's 'nod' is the engine of the story.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ's weeping and seeking the effective action that creates the 'yes'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You have only to strike out,' use 'Christ has struck out on the path to find you, and his finding you is your peace.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one who must 'not miss' the visitation.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the visitation is an act of God that overcomes human blindness.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the Spirit's power to open 'blind eyes' rather than the duty to see.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Describe the 'blindness' as a condition we cannot break on our own.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make Grace necessary rather than just helpful.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (National duty) is fused with Soteriology.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Establish God's visitation as an accomplished fact in Christ, then derive national responsibility.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful and emotionally resonant, but it risks leaving the hearer with a new law: the law of 'having to respond correctly' to grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is a masterpiece of pathos; actantially, it is a call to human action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical Jerusalem; semiotics reveals the 'America-as-Jerusalem' actantial substitution.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Grace' is used as a 'Sender' of values that the 'Subject' (Hearer) must still achieve through 'Vouloir'.

volledige_subject_lijst: You have only to strike out
volledige_object_lijst: The things that make for peace
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Visitation' metaphor, which functions as a 'Mandate' in the Greimasian sense.
